9.969 huda: When I 1st picked up the ipad my sister and I shared. I didn't know it would offer me much more than its 3,145,728 pixels instead, it became a lens through which I learned to decode the real world. We don't just play video games. They play us, too. 375 00:40:40.060 --> 00:40:53.089 huda: When I solved a complex Redstone circuit in Minecraft, an automatic farm that resembled the one on the way to the grocery store. It wasn't just the game's mechanics that mattered. It was my statistics homework. That night 376 00:40:53.230 --> 00:41:01.970 huda: when, faced with a tricky, graphing problem, I approached it with the same strategy, step by step, like placing redstone components. I plotted analytics on the axes. 377 00:41:02.180 --> 00:41:08.540 huda: Even this past summer at Data Science Camp. I saw Redstone every time I fed data into regression models. 378 00:41:09.240 --> 00:41:21.489 huda: People praise games for the immersive experiences, but they often miss the point. It's how we carry that immersion into the real real world that matters how it bleeds into our decision, making our approaches to solving problems. 379 00:41:21.740 --> 00:41:28.080 huda: Soon it became routine, switching from a gladiator to a manager faster than you can press. Alt tab. 380 00:41:28.160 --> 00:41:38.220 huda: Perhaps it's this same innate ability that allows me to switch between Urdu and English without a second thought or from technical jargon at hackathons, to advocacy, at journalism conferences. 381 00:41:38.270 --> 00:41:54.100 huda: Each role comes with its own set of expectations and rules of engagement. Who am I, when not bound to one narrative, one language, or one role? And yet behind all the role switching and analytical skills I gained from games. There was one thing I had lost my individuality. 382 00:41:54.390 --> 00:42:00.389 huda: One evening, while playing assassin's creed, I spotted a woman, brown skinned, with surma in her eyes like me. 383 00:42:00.580 --
